text: These are the official results of the Men's 100 metres event at the 1993 IAAF World Championships in Stuttgart, Germany. There were a total number of 70 participating athletes, with nine qualifying heats and the final held on Sunday 1993-08-15. At 33 years, 135 days old, Linford Christie became the oldest ever world champion for the men's 100 m. ==Final== {| class="wikitable" style="border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 90%;" !RANK !align="left" style="width: 18em"|FINAL !TIME |- |align="center"|Image:Med 1.png | |align="center"|9.87 ER |- |align="center"|Image:Med 2.png | |align="center"|9.92 |- |align="center"|Image:Med 3.png | |align="center"|9.99 |- |align="center"|4. | |align="center"|10.02 |- |align="center"|5. | |align="center"|10.02 |- |align="center"|6. | |align="center"|10.03 |- |align="center"|7. | |align="center"|10.04 |- |align="center"|8. | |align="center"|10.18 |} ==Semifinals== *Held on Sunday 1993-08-15 {| class="wikitable" style="border-collapse: collapse;
